message.content: Read .scaffold_context and app_metadata.json. Analyze data, decide UI paradigm in 1-2 sentences, then implement directly. Follow .claude/skills/frontend-impl/SKILL.md. Use existing types and services from src/types/ and src/services/. Run 'npm run build' when done. Deployment is automatic.

content.text: I'll start by reading the necessary files to understand the app structure.

content.text:
This is a marketplace app ("Marktplatz") for listing items for sale. The best UI paradigm is a **card-based marketplace grid** — like a classifieds board — where users can browse listings visually, filter by category/condition, and create new listings directly from the dashboard.

Now let me read the SKILL.md and current DashboardOverview.tsx:

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: frontend-impl
     3→description: |
     4→  Activate this skill when:
     5→  - Building DashboardOverview.tsx
     6→  - Writing React/TypeScript code
     7→  - Integrating with Living Apps API
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Read
    10→  - Write
    11→  - Edit
    12→  - Bash
    13→  - Glob
    14→  - Grep
    15→---
    16→
    17→# Frontend Implementation Skill
    18→
    19→Build a **production-ready, domain-specific dashboard** as the app's primary workspace.
    20→
    21→---
    22→
    23→## Step 1: Analyze and Decide (MANDATORY — before any code)
    24→
    25→Read `.scaffold_context` and `app_metadata.json`. Then write 1-2 sentences describing:
    26→
    27→1. **What is the best UI paradigm for the user's core workflow?**
    28→2. **Why is this the most natural way to interact with THIS data?**
    29→
    30→Use this table to guide your choice:
    31→
    32→| Data Nature | Best UI Paradigm |
    33→|-------------|-----------------|
    34→| Time-based / scheduled entries | Calendar, week planner, timeline |
    35→| Status-based / workflow stages | Kanban board, progress pipeline |
    36→| Quantitative / goal-tracking | Progress rings, gauges, trend charts |
    37→| Hierarchical / categorized | Grouped sections, nested views |
    38→| Sequential / step-by-step | Stepper, checklist, flow view |
    39→| Relational / many linked items | Master-detail, linked cards |
    40→
    41→Then implement immediately. No design_brief.md, no task lists, no planning documents.
    42→
    43→---
    44→
    45→## Step 2: Edit Layout.tsx (title only)
    46→
    47→Use Edit to change `APP_TITLE` and `APP_SUBTITLE`. Nothing else.
    48→
    49→## Step 3: Build DashboardOverview.tsx
    50→
    51→**Mandatory sequence:**
    52→1. **Read** `src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx` using the Read tool
    53→2. **Write** `src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx` ONCE with the complete content
    54→
    55→**NEVER use Bash (cat/echo/heredoc) for file operations.** If Read or Write fails, retry with the same tool.
    56→
    57→## Step 4: Deploy
    58→
    59→```bash
    60→npm run build
    61→```
    62→
    63→Then call `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`
    64→
    65→---
    66→
    67→## What Is Pre-Generated (DO NOT touch!)
    68→
    69→CRUD sub-pages, dialogs, routing, sidebar, shared components, and the design system are pre-generated.
    70→
    71→**DO NOT touch:** index.css, CRUD pages, dialogs, App.tsx, PageShell.tsx, StatCard.tsx, ConfirmDialog.tsx, ChatWidget.tsx, useDashboardData.ts, enriched.ts, enrich.ts, formatters.ts, ai.ts, chat-context.ts.
    72→
    73→**EDITABLE:** `src/config/ai-features.ts` — toggle `AI_PHOTO_SCAN['EntityName'] = true` to enable the "Foto scannen" button in that entity's create/edit dialog. Useful for entities where users may photograph documents, receipts, or business cards to auto-fill form fields.
    74→
    75→`index.css` contains the shared design system (Plus Jakarta Sans, indigo palette, dark sidebar). All semantic tokens (`bg-primary`, `text-muted-foreground`, `bg-sidebar`, etc.) are ready to use. Do NOT edit index.css — use existing tokens in your components.
    76→
    77→**Already available in DashboardOverview.tsx:**
    78→- `useDashboardData()` — all entities loaded, lookup maps built, loading/error handled
    79→- `enrichX()` — applookup fields resolved to display name strings
    80→- `formatDate()`, `formatCurrency()` — locale-aware formatting
    81→- Loading skeleton and error state with retry
    82→
    83→**AI utilities available in `src/lib/ai.ts`:**
    84→- `chatCompletion()` — core LLM call
    85→- `classify()` — auto-categorize text
    86→- `extract()` — structured data from text
    87→- `summarize()` — condense text
    88→- `translate()` — translate text
    89→- `analyzeImage()`, `extractFromPhoto()` — image analysis
    90→- `analyzeDocument()` — PDF/document analysis
    91→- `fileToDataUri()` — encode File for AI calls
    92→- `safeJsonCompletion()`, `withRetry()` — error handling
    93→
    94→---
    95→
    96→## Dashboard = Primary Workspace, NOT Info Page
    97→
    98→**The #1 mistake is building the dashboard as a passive info screen** (KPI cards + chart + recent activity). Users want to WORK with their data, not just look at it.
    99→
   100→### The Core Interactive Component
   101→
   102→Every dashboard needs ONE interactive component — the **reason users open the app**. This component:
   103→
   104→- Takes up significant screen space (hero, not sidebar widget)
   105→- Supports create, edit, delete directly (click empty slot → create dialog, click entry → edit)
   106→- Shows data in its most natural form (the paradigm you chose in Step 1)
   107→- Provides immediate visual feedback
   108→
   109→The pre-generated CRUD list pages are a fallback. Users should do 90% of their work without leaving the dashboard.
   110→
   111→**ALWAYS reuse pre-generated dialogs** — When the dashboard needs create/edit forms, import `{Entity}Dialog` from `@/components/dialogs/{Entity}Dialog`. Never build custom dialog forms from scratch — the pre-generated ones already have all field types, photo scan, validation, and applookup selects.
   112→
   113→### Anti-Slop Checklist (if ANY true, redesign!)
   114→
   115→- Dashboard is a passive info page — only KPI cards and charts
   116→- No domain-specific UI — uses generic list/table for core data
   117→- All KPI cards look identical
   118→- Layout is a boring 2x2 or 3x3 grid
   119→- No clear hero element
   120→- Colors are generic blue/green/red (use the pre-configured palette tokens instead)
   121→- Dashboard could be for ANY app
   122→
   123→---
   124→
   125→## Design Principles
   126→
   127→### Theme
   128→
   129→Font (Plus Jakarta Sans) and color palette (indigo accent, warm off-white base, dark sidebar) are pre-configured in `index.css`. Use existing semantic tokens — do NOT add custom CSS variables unless the dashboard requires truly app-specific values (e.g. `--calendar-slot-height`).
   130→
   131→Create typography hierarchy through weight differences (font-300 vs font-700) and size jumps (text-2xl vs text-sm).
   132→
   133→### Layout: Visual Interest Required
   134→
   135→Every layout needs variation — size, weight, spacing, format, typography. If everything is the same size in identical cards, it's AI slop.
   136→
   137→**Mobile:** Vertical flow, thumb-friendly, hero dominates first viewport.
   138→**Desktop:** Use horizontal space, multi-column where appropriate, hover reveals.
   139→
   140→---
   141→
   142→## Pre-Generated Component APIs (exact props — do NOT Read to check, do NOT guess)
   143→
   144→**`{Entity}Dialog`** — always this exact interface:
   145→```tsx
   146→<KurseDialog
   147→  open={dialogOpen}
   148→  onClose={() => setDialogOpen(false)}
   149→  onSubmit={async (fields) => { await LivingAppsService.createKurseEntry(fields); fetchAll(); }} // dialog closes itself on success
   150→  defaultValues={editRecord?.fields}         // undefined = create, fields = edit
   151→  dozentenList={dozenten}                    // list prop = {entityIdentifier}List — matches useDashboardData key exactly
   152→  raeumeList={raeume}                        // dozenten → dozentenList, raeume → raeumeList (NOT dozentList/raumList)
   153→  enablePhotoScan={AI_PHOTO_SCAN['Kurse']}   // import AI_PHOTO_SCAN from '@/config/ai-features'
   154→/>
   155→```
   156→
   157→**Applookup `defaultValues` need full record URLs — NEVER raw IDs:**
   158→```tsx
   159→// ❌ WRONG — raw ID breaks the Select
   160→defaultValues={{ kurs: selectedKursId }}
   161→
   162→// ✅ CORRECT
   163→import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';
   164→import { createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   165→defaultValues={{ kurs: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.KURSE, selectedKursId) }}
   166→```
   167→
   168→**`StatCard`** — `icon` must be rendered JSX, NOT a component reference:
   169→```tsx
   170→// ✅ CORRECT
   171→<StatCard title="Kurse" value="42" description="Gesamt" icon={<BookOpen size={18} className="text-muted-foreground" />} />
   172→// ❌ WRONG — causes runtime error
   173→<StatCard icon={BookOpen} />
   174→```
   175→
   176→**`ConfirmDialog`** — uses `onClose` (not `onCancel`):
   177→```tsx
   178→<ConfirmDialog
   179→  open={!!deleteTarget}
   180→  title="Eintrag löschen"
   181→  description="Wirklich löschen?"
   182→  onConfirm={handleDelete}
   183→  onClose={() => setDeleteTarget(null)}
   184→/>
   185→```
   186→
   187→## Critical Implementation Rules
   188→
   189→### Type Imports
   190→```typescript
   191→// ❌ WRONG
   192→import { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   193→// ✅ CORRECT
   194→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   195→```
   196→
   197→### extractRecordId Null Check
   198→```typescript
   199→const id = extractRecordId(record.fields.relation);
   200→if (!id) return;
   201→```
   202→
   203→### Dates Without Seconds
   204→```typescript
   205→const dateForAPI = formData.date + 'T12:00'; // YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM only
   206→```
   207→
   208→### Select Never Empty Value
   209→```typescript
   210→// ❌ <SelectItem value="">None</SelectItem>
   211→// ✅ <SelectItem value="none">None</SelectItem>
   212→```
   213→
   214→---
   215→
   216→## Completeness Checklist
   217→
   218→### Core Component
   219→- [ ] Interactive component implements the chosen UI paradigm
   220→- [ ] Users can create, edit, delete directly from the dashboard
   221→- [ ] Component takes significant screen space (hero element)
   222→
   223→### Technical
   224→- [ ] `npm run build` passes
   225→- [ ] Empty state handled (loading/error are pre-generated)
   226→- [ ] No hardcoded demo data
   227→- [ ] Responsive: mobile and desktop layouts
   228→
   229→---
   230→
   231→## Living Apps API Reference
   232→
   233→### Date Formats (STRICT!)
   234→
   235→| Field Type | Format | Example |
   236→|------------|--------|---------|
   237→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
   238→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
   239→
   240→NO seconds for `datetimeminute`!
   241→
   242→### applookup Fields
   243→
   244→Store full URLs: `https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}`
   245→
   246→```typescript
   247→import { extractRecordId, createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   248→import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';
   249→
   250→const recordId = extractRecordId(record.fields.category);
   251→if (!recordId) return;
   252→
   253→const data = { category: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.CATEGORIES, selectedId) };
   254→```
   255→
   256→### API Response Format
   257→
   258→Returns **object**, NOT array. Use `Object.entries()` to extract `record_id`.
   259→
   260→---
   261→
   262→## Data Access (pre-generated — do NOT rewrite)
   263→
   264→All data fetching, lookup maps, and enrichment are pre-generated. In DashboardOverview.tsx:
   265→
   266→```typescript
   267→// Already in the skeleton — just use the data:
   268→const { kurse, anmeldungen, dozentenMap, loading, error, fetchAll } = useDashboardData();
   269→const enrichedKurse = enrichKurse(kurse, dozentenMap, raeumeMap);
   270→```
   271→
   272→For CRUD after user actions:
   273→
   274→```typescript
   275→const handleCreate = async (fields) => {
   276→  await LivingAppsService.createKurseEntry(fields);
   277→  fetchAll();
   278→};
   279→
   280→const handleDelete = async (id: string) => {
   281→  await LivingAppsService.deleteKurseEntry(id);
   282→  fetchAll();
   283→};
   284→```
   285→
   286→## Chart Pattern (recharts)
   287→
   288→```typescript
   289→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
   290→
   291→<ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={300}>
   292→  <LineChart data={data}>
   293→    <XAxis dataKey="name" stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   294→    <YAxis stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
   295→    <Tooltip contentStyle={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--background)', border: '1px solid var(--border)' }} />
   296→    <Line type="monotone" dataKey="value" stroke="var(--primary)" strokeWidth={2} dot={false} />
   297→  </LineChart>
   298→</ResponsiveContainer>
   299→```
   300→
   301→## Available Libraries
   302→
   303→- **shadcn/ui** — all components in `src/components/ui/`
   304→- **recharts** — LineChart, BarChart, PieChart, AreaChart
   305→- **lucide-react** — icons
   306→- **date-fns** — date formatting with `de` locale
   307→
   308→## Formatting (pre-generated — just import)
   309→
   310→```typescript
   311→import { formatDate, formatCurrency } from '@/lib/formatters';
   312→
   313→formatDate(record.fields.startdatum);     // "06.11.2025" or "Nov 6, 2025"
   314→formatCurrency(record.fields.preis);      // "199,00 €" or "$199.00"
   315→```
   316→

<system-reminder>

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

file.content:
---
name: frontend-impl
description: |
  Activate this skill when:
  - Building DashboardOverview.tsx
  - Writing React/TypeScript code
  - Integrating with Living Apps API
allowed-tools:
  - Read
  - Write
  - Edit
  - Bash
  - Glob
  - Grep
---

# Frontend Implementation Skill

Build a **production-ready, domain-specific dashboard** as the app's primary workspace.

---

## Step 1: Analyze and Decide (MANDATORY — before any code)

Read `.scaffold_context` and `app_metadata.json`. Then write 1-2 sentences describing:

1. **What is the best UI paradigm for the user's core workflow?**
2. **Why is this the most natural way to interact with THIS data?**

Use this table to guide your choice:

| Data Nature | Best UI Paradigm |
|-------------|-----------------|
| Time-based / scheduled entries | Calendar, week planner, timeline |
| Status-based / workflow stages | Kanban board, progress pipeline |
| Quantitative / goal-tracking | Progress rings, gauges, trend charts |
| Hierarchical / categorized | Grouped sections, nested views |
| Sequential / step-by-step | Stepper, checklist, flow view |
| Relational / many linked items | Master-detail, linked cards |

Then implement immediately. No design_brief.md, no task lists, no planning documents.

---

## Step 2: Edit Layout.tsx (title only)

Use Edit to change `APP_TITLE` and `APP_SUBTITLE`. Nothing else.

## Step 3: Build DashboardOverview.tsx

**Mandatory sequence:**
1. **Read** `src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx` using the Read tool
2. **Write** `src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx` ONCE with the complete content

**NEVER use Bash (cat/echo/heredoc) for file operations.** If Read or Write fails, retry with the same tool.

## Step 4: Deploy

```bash
npm run build
```

Then call `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`

---

## What Is Pre-Generated (DO NOT touch!)

CRUD sub-pages, dialogs, routing, sidebar, shared components, and the design system are pre-generated.

**DO NOT touch:** index.css, CRUD pages, dialogs, App.tsx, PageShell.tsx, StatCard.tsx, ConfirmDialog.tsx, ChatWidget.tsx, useDashboardData.ts, enriched.ts, enrich.ts, formatters.ts, ai.ts, chat-context.ts.

**EDITABLE:** `src/config/ai-features.ts` — toggle `AI_PHOTO_SCAN['EntityName'] = true` to enable the "Foto scannen" button in that entity's create/edit dialog. Useful for entities where users may photograph documents, receipts, or business cards to auto-fill form fields.

`index.css` contains the shared design system (Plus Jakarta Sans, indigo palette, dark sidebar). All semantic tokens (`bg-primary`, `text-muted-foreground`, `bg-sidebar`, etc.) are ready to use. Do NOT edit index.css — use existing tokens in your components.

**Already available in DashboardOverview.tsx:**
- `useDashboardData()` — all entities loaded, lookup maps built, loading/error handled
- `enrichX()` — applookup fields resolved to display name strings
- `formatDate()`, `formatCurrency()` — locale-aware formatting
- Loading skeleton and error state with retry

**AI utilities available in `src/lib/ai.ts`:**
- `chatCompletion()` — core LLM call
- `classify()` — auto-categorize text
- `extract()` — structured data from text
- `summarize()` — condense text
- `translate()` — translate text
- `analyzeImage()`, `extractFromPhoto()` — image analysis
- `analyzeDocument()` — PDF/document analysis
- `fileToDataUri()` — encode File for AI calls
- `safeJsonCompletion()`, `withRetry()` — error handling

---

## Dashboard = Primary Workspace, NOT Info Page

**The #1 mistake is building the dashboard as a passive info screen** (KPI cards + chart + recent activity). Users want to WORK with their data, not just look at it.

### The Core Interactive Component

Every dashboard needs ONE interactive component — the **reason users open the app**. This component:

- Takes up significant screen space (hero, not sidebar widget)
- Supports create, edit, delete directly (click empty slot → create dialog, click entry → edit)
- Shows data in its most natural form (the paradigm you chose in Step 1)
- Provides immediate visual feedback

The pre-generated CRUD list pages are a fallback. Users should do 90% of their work without leaving the dashboard.

**ALWAYS reuse pre-generated dialogs** — When the dashboard needs create/edit forms, import `{Entity}Dialog` from `@/components/dialogs/{Entity}Dialog`. Never build custom dialog forms from scratch — the pre-generated ones already have all field types, photo scan, validation, and applookup selects.

### Anti-Slop Checklist (if ANY true, redesign!)

- Dashboard is a passive info page — only KPI cards and charts
- No domain-specific UI — uses generic list/table for core data
- All KPI cards look identical
- Layout is a boring 2x2 or 3x3 grid
- No clear hero element
- Colors are generic blue/green/red (use the pre-configured palette tokens instead)
- Dashboard could be for ANY app

---

## Design Principles

### Theme

Font (Plus Jakarta Sans) and color palette (indigo accent, warm off-white base, dark sidebar) are pre-configured in `index.css`. Use existing semantic tokens — do NOT add custom CSS variables unless the dashboard requires truly app-specific values (e.g. `--calendar-slot-height`).

Create typography hierarchy through weight differences (font-300 vs font-700) and size jumps (text-2xl vs text-sm).

### Layout: Visual Interest Required

Every layout needs variation — size, weight, spacing, format, typography. If everything is the same size in identical cards, it's AI slop.

**Mobile:** Vertical flow, thumb-friendly, hero dominates first viewport.
**Desktop:** Use horizontal space, multi-column where appropriate, hover reveals.

---

## Pre-Generated Component APIs (exact props — do NOT Read to check, do NOT guess)

**`{Entity}Dialog`** — always this exact interface:
```tsx
<KurseDialog
  open={dialogOpen}
  onClose={() => setDialogOpen(false)}
  onSubmit={async (fields) => { await LivingAppsService.createKurseEntry(fields); fetchAll(); }} // dialog closes itself on success
  defaultValues={editRecord?.fields}         // undefined = create, fields = edit
  dozentenList={dozenten}                    // list prop = {entityIdentifier}List — matches useDashboardData key exactly
  raeumeList={raeume}                        // dozenten → dozentenList, raeume → raeumeList (NOT dozentList/raumList)
  enablePhotoScan={AI_PHOTO_SCAN['Kurse']}   // import AI_PHOTO_SCAN from '@/config/ai-features'
/>
```

**Applookup `defaultValues` need full record URLs — NEVER raw IDs:**
```tsx
// ❌ WRONG — raw ID breaks the Select
defaultValues={{ kurs: selectedKursId }}

// ✅ CORRECT
import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';
import { createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
defaultValues={{ kurs: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.KURSE, selectedKursId) }}
```

**`StatCard`** — `icon` must be rendered JSX, NOT a component reference:
```tsx
// ✅ CORRECT
<StatCard title="Kurse" value="42" description="Gesamt" icon={<BookOpen size={18} className="text-muted-foreground" />} />
// ❌ WRONG — causes runtime error
<StatCard icon={BookOpen} />
```

**`ConfirmDialog`** — uses `onClose` (not `onCancel`):
```tsx
<ConfirmDialog
  open={!!deleteTarget}
  title="Eintrag löschen"
  description="Wirklich löschen?"
  onConfirm={handleDelete}
  onClose={() => setDeleteTarget(null)}
/>
```

## Critical Implementation Rules

### Type Imports
```typescript
// ❌ WRONG
import { Workout } from '@/types/app';
// ✅ CORRECT
import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
```

### extractRecordId Null Check
```typescript
const id = extractRecordId(record.fields.relation);
if (!id) return;
```

### Dates Without Seconds
```typescript
const dateForAPI = formData.date + 'T12:00'; // YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM only
```

### Select Never Empty Value
```typescript
// ❌ <SelectItem value="">None</SelectItem>
// ✅ <SelectItem value="none">None</SelectItem>
```

---

## Completeness Checklist

### Core Component
- [ ] Interactive component implements the chosen UI paradigm
- [ ] Users can create, edit, delete directly from the dashboard
- [ ] Component takes significant screen space (hero element)

### Technical
- [ ] `npm run build` passes
- [ ] Empty state handled (loading/error are pre-generated)
- [ ] No hardcoded demo data
- [ ] Responsive: mobile and desktop layouts

---

## Living Apps API Reference

### Date Formats (STRICT!)

| Field Type | Format | Example |
|------------|--------|---------|
| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |

NO seconds for `datetimeminute`!

### applookup Fields

Store full URLs: `https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}`

```typescript
import { extractRecordId, createRecordUrl } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
import { APP_IDS } from '@/types/app';

const recordId = extractRecordId(record.fields.category);
if (!recordId) return;

const data = { category: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.CATEGORIES, selectedId) };
```

### API Response Format

Returns **object**, NOT array. Use `Object.entries()` to extract `record_id`.

---

## Data Access (pre-generated — do NOT rewrite)

All data fetching, lookup maps, and enrichment are pre-generated. In DashboardOverview.tsx:

```typescript
// Already in the skeleton — just use the data:
const { kurse, anmeldungen, dozentenMap, loading, error, fetchAll } = useDashboardData();
const enrichedKurse = enrichKurse(kurse, dozentenMap, raeumeMap);
```

For CRUD after user actions:

```typescript
const handleCreate = async (fields) => {
  await LivingAppsService.createKurseEntry(fields);
  fetchAll();
};

const handleDelete = async (id: string) => {
  await LivingAppsService.deleteKurseEntry(id);
  fetchAll();
};
```

## Chart Pattern (recharts)

```typescript
import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';

<ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={300}>
  <LineChart data={data}>
    <XAxis dataKey="name" stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
    <YAxis stroke="var(--muted-foreground)" />
    <Tooltip contentStyle={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--background)', border: '1px solid var(--border)' }} />
    <Line type="monotone" dataKey="value" stroke="var(--primary)" strokeWidth={2} dot={false} />
  </LineChart>
</ResponsiveContainer>
```

## Available Libraries

- **shadcn/ui** — all components in `src/components/ui/`
- **recharts** — LineChart, BarChart, PieChart, AreaChart
- **lucide-react** — icons
- **date-fns** — date formatting with `de` locale

## Formatting (pre-generated — just import)

```typescript
import { formatDate, formatCurrency } from '@/lib/formatters';

formatDate(record.fields.startdatum);     // "06.11.2025" or "Nov 6, 2025"
formatCurrency(record.fields.preis);      // "199,00 €" or "$199.00"
```

content.text: Now I'll update the Layout title and write the full DashboardOverview in parallel:

message.content:
🔴 LIVE PREVIEW MODE - Der User sieht deine Änderungen in Echtzeit!

User-Anfrage: "ich will neben meinen Produkt Kacheln auch ein leeres Kacheln haben mit Plus icon was ich nutzen kann um schnell ein neues item hinzuzufügen"

⚡ WICHTIG: Der Vite Dev-Server läuft BEREITS! Der User sieht jede Dateiänderung SOFORT im Browser!

SCHRITTE (arbeite INKREMENTELL für Live-Updates):

1. LESEN: Lies src/pages/Dashboard.tsx um die aktuelle Struktur zu verstehen

2. ÄNDERN (SCHRITT FÜR SCHRITT!):
   - Mache EINE Änderung (z.B. Farbe ändern)
   - Die Datei wird sofort geschrieben → User sieht es LIVE! ⚡
   - Mache die NÄCHSTE Änderung
   - Wieder sofort sichtbar!
   
3. TESTEN: Am Ende 'npm run build' um sicherzustellen dass es kompiliert

⚠️ KRITISCH für Live-Preview:
- Arbeite SCHRITT FÜR SCHRITT, nicht alles auf einmal!
- Jede Dateiänderung = Live-Update im Browser!
- Rufe NICHT deploy_to_github auf!
- Der User testet die Änderungen in der Live-Preview

Das Dashboard existiert bereits. Mache NUR die angeforderten Änderungen.
